Title: NetSuite Account Executive - Emerging Markets - Nashville, TN / Burlington, MA
ExternalDescriptionStr:
About Oracle NetSuite 

Do you want to advance your career with the world’s first cloud company? Since 1998, Oracle NetSuite has been on a mission to deliver an agile, unified application suite that gives leaders a complete view into their business. Our team is growing, and we’re looking for people like you to help us make a global impact.

As the leading cloud business system, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.  

NetSuite is a place where you can build your career and have fun while doing so! We’re invested in our people, our customers, and the community. As part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that you’re ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success.

With a focus on start-ups and small businesses, our Emerging Markets team is seeking Sales Account Executives with a successful background selling software.  Ideal candidates are in the early stages of their sales career with 1-3 years of success in a closing sales or business development role selling software.  This role requires an in-office presence.

Click here to learn more about Oracle NetSuite! 

#lifeatNetSuite

More about the Opportunity:

  • Working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, you are responsible for selling the entire suite of NetSuite products: ERP, CRM, e-commerce, EPM and HCM. 
  • You have support from a Business Development Representative to help secure new business.
  • Develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the business applications.
  • Participate in the creation, presentation and sale of a complete value proposition via the telephone, internet, and in-person customer meetings. 

About You:

  • You have 1-3 years of SaaS/Technology sales and a desire to succeed.
  • You are a regular on your company’s top producer’s list and have the stats to back it up.
  • You are known for your tremendous work ethic, laser focus, passion, and dedication.
  • You enjoy learning technology and can translate that into value for prospects.
  • You’re curious, insightful, and perceptive.

About the Team:

  • Strong experience working in collaborative, team-based environments.
  • We value outstanding writing skills and a friendly, thoughtful, and effective communication style.
  • We strive for attention to detail, emotional intelligence, and quick turnaround times.
  • We get stuff done. And fast.

 

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

 

At Oracle, we do not just value differences—we celebrate them. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people work together. We believe innovation starts with diversity and inclusion. https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/culture/diversity.html

Career Level - IC1
CorporateDescriptionStr:
As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer
ShortDescriptionStr: Ideal candidates are in the early stages of their sales career with 1-3 years of success in a closing sales or business development role selling software.
ExternalQualificationsStr:
Disclaimer:

Certain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.

Range and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only

US: Hiring Range: from $24.04 to $38.56 per hour; from $50,000 to $80,200 per annum. May be eligible for equity. Eligible for commission with an estimated pay mix of 50/50.

Oracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle’s differing products, industries and lines of business.
Candidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.

Oracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:
1. Medical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion
2. Short term disability and long term disability
3. Life insurance and AD&D
4. Supplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
5. Health care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts
6. Pre-tax commuter and parking benefits
7. 401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match
8. Paid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.
9. 11 paid holidays
10. Paid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.
11. Paid parental leave
12. Adoption assistance
13. Employee Stock Purchase Plan
14. Financial planning and group legal
15. Voluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance

Title: HR Analyst
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Do you love supporting employees and finding answers to complex problems?
Our dynamic HR Services Team would love to meet you!

In this role, you will support the system administration of Human Resources customer support ticketing system, Oracle Service Cloud. This is a key role in our team that will design, develop, and implement creative solutions to improve system functionality, the customer support experience, and operational excellence. You will analyze complex, confidential, and time sensitive data. You will be looking for system problem trends, and seeking opportunities for process and system improvement. You will need to collaborate across multiple business functions, as well as globally to ensure team success. Other primary responsibilities will include data analysis, training and executive presentations and updates -, project management, and customer service. You will have the opportunity to work and collaborate globally, standardizing, simplifying and automating HR operational processes and services.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
complex,confidential,andtimesensitivedatasensitiveimprovementscontributeavarietyofavarietyofdetermineresolveavarietyofimprovementproblemsolvingattentiontodetailpatiencepatienceabilitytocommunicateYouarepassionatecultureslearningopportunitiescontributeimprovementdailytasksBachelor’sdegrPlease note: The HR Services teams works a hybrid schedule and the team is in the office in Rocklin, CA on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays each week. Only candidates local to the Rocklin, CA area will be considered.
  • You will partner with management and other key collaborators to process complex, confidential, and time sensitive data 
  • You will make recommendations, participate in UAT testing, implement systems and process improvements
  • You will drive tasks to completion
  • You will contribute independently on a variety of processes, with some assistance and normally receive general instructions on routine work 
  • You will work on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors
  • You exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action 
  • You will develop professional expertise, and apply company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues 
  • You will assist others using your own expertise 
  • You will perform additional related tasks and duties as needed

 

  • You possess process improvement, training, communication and project management skills
  • You have excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills
  • You are comfortable with full Microsoft office suite, HCM, and other Oracle Cloud applications
  • You have a high attention to detail and the patience to pursue data anomalies that most of us miss
  • You have strong internal client facing skills with a flexible communication style and the ability to communicate complex concepts and analytics in a structured manner
  • You are passionate about trouble shooting data issues to identify strategic solutions
  • You believe that no jobs are too big; no problems are too complex
  • You can communicate effectively – directly and succinctly – across cubicles, organizational boundaries and cultures
  • You volunteer – for new experiences, learning opportunities and to help others
  • You contribute and may lead process improvement ideas and innovation
  • You have 2+ years of experience working in a data intensive environment, preferably in human resources, where data entry, record auditing and report generation are daily tasks of your role
  • Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred.

Career Level - IC1

ShortDescriptionStr: This position requires an onsite presence in our Rocklin, CA office. Local candidates will be considered. Oracle’s HR Services team strives to create and deliver a seamless and positive employee experience across the entire employee lifecycle. Leading with care and empathy, we develop efficient and simple processes, systems, policies, and programs. We deliver data that is useful and accurate to create people-related strategies across the business. We manage people data and build project management capability across HR. Our work also ensures Oracle remains protected and compliant. We strive to provide employees the resources and support they need during the most important moments in their careers.

7. 401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match
8. Paid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.
9. 11 paid holidays
10. Paid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.
11. Paid parental leave
12. Adoption assistance
13. Employee Stock Purchase Plan
14. Financial planning and group legal
15. Voluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance
InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
Please note: The HR Services teams works a hybrid schedule and the team is in the office in Rocklin, CA on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays each week. Only candidates local to the Rocklin, CA area will be considered.

  • You will partner with management and other key collaborators to process complex, confidential, and time sensitive data 
  • You will make recommendations, participate in UAT testing, implement systems and process improvements
  • You will drive tasks to completion
  • You will contribute independently on a variety of processes, with some assistance and normally receive general instructions on routine work 
  • You will work on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors
  • You exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices for appropriate action 
  • You will develop professional expertise, and apply company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues 
  • You will assist others using your own expertise 
  • You will perform additional related tasks and duties as needed

 

  • You possess process improvement, training, communication and project management skills
  • You have excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills
  • You are comfortable with full Microsoft office suite, HCM, and other Oracle Cloud applications
  • You have a high attention to detail and the patience to pursue data anomalies that most of us miss
  • You have strong internal client facing skills with a flexible communication style and the ability to communicate complex concepts and analytics in a structured manner
  • You are passionate about trouble shooting data issues to identify strategic solutions
  • You believe that no jobs are too big; no problems are too complex
  • You can communicate effectively – directly and succinctly – across cubicles, organizational boundaries and cultures
  • You volunteer – for new experiences, learning opportunities and to help others
  • You contribute and may lead process improvement ideas and innovation
  • You have 2+ years of experience working in a data intensive environment, preferably in human resources, where data entry, record auditing and report generation are daily tasks of your role
  • Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred.

Oracle has great benefits!

Title: DevOps Analyst - System Analyst II - Day Shift
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Building off our Cloud momentum, Oracle has formed a new organization - Health Data Intelligence Platform. This team will focus on product development and product strategy for Oracle Health, while building out a complete platform supporting modernized, automated healthcare. This is a net new line of business, constructed with an entrepreneurial spirit that promotes an upbeat and creative environment. We are unencumbered and will need your contribution to make it a premier engineering center with the focus on excellence. 

Health Data Intelligence Platform has a rare opportunity to play a critical role in how Oracle Health products impact and reinvent the healthcare industry by redefining how healthcare and technology intersect.

You will have the opportunity to:

  • Reach billions of people with our products & services
  • Create technology in which truly impacts the world
  • Ability to have immediate impact on developing technology
  • Unlimited growth potential with inspiring work
  • Work with the best minds in the industry
  • Enjoy working in an open, diverse, and productive environment

As a System Analyst II, you will be the technical resource for monitoring and deploying production systems and applications for our clients. Your primary tasks will include:

  • On-call and support of applications and infrastructure
  • Application deployment and monitoring
  • Security patching
  • Liaison between the US Federal Cloud support and core Application and Infrastructure development teams.

Qualifications:

  • U.S. Citizenship on U.S. soil is required. This position requires you to be eligible to receive a federal security clearance which requires you to be a U.S. Citizen. 
  • At least 4 years total combined completed higher education and/or related work experience including:Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or related field, or equivalent meaningful work experience.
  • Good knowledge and hands on Experience with Linux and SQL
  • At least 1 year experience in Application Support and CI/CD pipelines or Infrastructure Support

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proficiency in technologies and design concepts around Container Platforms, Big Data processing and relational databases, such as the Hadoop ecosystem, Map/Reduce, stream processing, etc. 
  • Experience with modern programming languages such as Java, C#, C/C++, or Ruby. 
  • Experience with production operations and good practices for putting quality code into production and troubleshooting issues when they arise. 
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with the team and other stakeholders. 
  • Preferably, production experience with Cloud and data processing technologies. 

Expectations:

  • 5-5-4-night shifts (7:00am - 7:00pm) 
  • Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations
  • Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position

Perform other responsibilities as assigned

 

Career Level - IC2
CorporateDescriptionStr:
As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
The Health Data and Intelligence Platform is excited to hire a System Analyst II. You will provide technical support for internal tools/applications and processes. In this role you will proactively monitor system/application alarms, investigate, analyze, resolve or escalate alarms and service requests. Perform deployment tasks in line with Oracle Release to Production SOPs and Work plans. Your responsibility also includes, prioritizing and handling work queue in accordance with service level agreements, documenting investigation and issue resolution, triaging issues to appropriate second-level resources for resolution, investigating and diagnosing performance issues of tools/applications. Additionally, you will troubleshoot by capturing information, testing workflows internally/externally, analyzing log files, querying tables and updating database fields.

Title: Data Center Facility Engineer Level 2
ExternalDescriptionStr:
You will report to the manager of Data Center Facility Engineering and will be responsible for managing low risk maintenance activities for the region.  As the facility engineer, you will coordinate with internal and external teams to ensure that power and build tickets are completed efficiently. You will also work with the local Data Center Operations teams to ensure all onsite rack containment is properly built out for cooling effectiveness.  Your role will be critical to supporting our customers growth and ensuring we deliver on our promises.

ShortDescriptionStr: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is seeking a Data Center Facilities Engineer for our facilities in Ashburn, VA If you are familiar with how the technology industry has evolved in the last decade, you will know that everybody’s online presence is moving to the cloud and that needs to live somewhere. In 2023, Oracle is a leader in every layer of the cloud; Iaas, PaaS, SaaS as well as hosting our own corporate infrastructure. Our Ashburn facilities are critical assets and we are seeking an engineer with expertise in mission critical environments. If you have exceptional attention to detail, superior technical expertise, and a desire to grow and develop your professional skills within a challenging and complex environment, we are looking for you!

InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
Your success will be measured by:

Technical

  • A desire to learn and participate in the creation and development of scalable engineering solutions
  • Ability to read and utilize electrical and mechanical schematics
  • Safely performing electrical switching operations
  • Review of MOPs and SOPs for accuracy, safety
  • Overseeing the maintenance activities performed by others to ensure they are conducted safely and correctly
  • Ensuring that Oracle change management policies are adhered to
  • Assisting with the testing of electrical and cooling systems and identifying issues and working on solutions
  • Supporting the resolution of engineering incidents
  • Assisting with the installation of electrical and cooling infrastructure

Testing and Verification

  • Following existing procedures and play a key role in the development and improvement of processes
  • Analyzing and validate system data and reports for accuracy and completeness
  • Undertaking risk assessments of supplier or partner works
  • Scheduling and track completion of preventive and corrective work items
  • Providing frequent reports on key performance indicators pertaining to space, power, and availability
  • Assist with developing dashboards and automation to support scalable solutions

Project Implementation

  • Implementation and tracking of project plans in conjunction with others
  • Participating in the development of technical and process improvements
  • Identifying potential issues and working with others to ensure project success

Oracle Competencies specific to this position:

  • Collaboration
  • Change Agility
  • Communicating for impact
  • Competitive edge
  • Inspirational leadership
  • Mastering complexity
  • Performance drive and execution

Core Skills:

  • Extensive use of Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and email
  • Detailed understanding of building electrical, mechanical, and fire/life safety systems
  • Good interpersonal and relationship building skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to synthesize information and distill into an executive summary
  • Ability to read and understand construction drawings

Education/experience:           

  • Associates degree or higher in an electrical or mechanical discipline preferred
  • At least 2 years of experience in operating and maintaining Data Center facilities

Title: Data Center Facility Engineer Level 2
ExternalDescriptionStr:
You will report to the manager of Data Center Facility Engineering and will be responsible for managing low risk maintenance activities for the region.  As the facility engineer, you will coordinate with internal and external teams to ensure that power and build tickets are completed efficiently. You will also work with the local Data Center Operations teams to ensure all onsite rack containment is properly built out for cooling effectiveness.  Your role will be critical to supporting our customers growth and ensuring we deliver on our promises.

Career Level - IC2
CorporateDescriptionStr:
As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer
ShortDescriptionStr: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is seeking a Data Center Facilities Engineer for our facilities in Ashburn. VA If you are familiar with how the technology industry has evolved in the last decade, you will know that everybody’s online presence is moving to the cloud and that needs to live somewhere. In 2023, Oracle is a leader in every layer of the cloud; Iaas, PaaS, SaaS as well as hosting our own corporate infrastructure. Our Ashburn facilities are critical assets and we are seeking an engineer with expertise in mission critical environments. If you have exceptional attention to detail, superior technical expertise, and a desire to grow and develop your professional skills within a challenging and complex environment, we are looking for you!

Title: Member of Technical Staff
ExternalDescriptionStr:
The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) team can provide you the opportunity to build and operate a suite of massive scale, integrated cloud services in a broadly distributed, multi-tenant cloud environment.  OCI is committed to providing the best in cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the world’s biggest challenges.

The OCI Security team is focused on ensuring that our cloud infrastructure is the safest and most reliable environment for development we can provide to our customers. The OCI Security team keeps up with the constantly evolving and challenging cyber-threat landscape, by developing novel solutions and products to prevent and mitigate cyber-attacks on the OCI.

We are looking for top notch engineers who are passionate about security and cloud technologies to join the OCI Security Analytics & Machine Learning team. The ideal candidate is an innovative self-starter who is looking to drive the development and delivery of large scale services. You will be responsible for working with cross functional teams including machine learning scientists, researchers from Oracle Labs and engineers to develop, and run large scale cloud services that use advanced machine learned/statistical models to detect and remediate cyber-threats in OCI.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop full stack, cloud based, web services solutions with high degree of scalability, reliability and availability.
  • Productizing machine learning model and workflows on the cloud infrastructure
  • Extensive collaboration with research and engineering teams to deliver complex large-scale projects
  • Show initiative and enthusiasm in tackling challenging problems with innovative designs

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience in software design, development and operation of large scale distributed systems
  • Solid programming skills in Java or C#/C++, and experience with scripting languages such as Python
  • Experience with databases or big data.
  • Effective communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment
  • Advanced critical thinking and problem solving abilities
  • BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent experience

Career Level - IC2

Title: UX Design Intern - Applications Development
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Oracle Design Internship Summer 2024 

https://design.oracle.com/

Grow your UX Design Career with Oracle Design 

Oracle Design is seeking current undergraduate junior students and graduating seniors who are looking to enter the exciting world of User Experience (UX) Design in Summer 2024. Thrive in this crucial role! We are a group of 600+ multi-disciplinary creatives from around the globe, dedicated to making the design profession more accessible and inclusive. Come and join our diverse and dynamic team to create brand-new applications that connect, empower, and delight our users. We are excited to work with you early in your career.

The Company

Oracle is the world’s leading provider of business software. With a presence in over 175 countries, we are one of the biggest technology companies on the planet. We use innovative emergent technologies to tackle real-world problems. From advancing energy efficiency to reimagining online commerce, the work we do is not only redefining the world of business, but also helping advance governments, power nonprofits, and giving billions of people tools they need to outpace change. 

What You’ll Bring: (Objective Minimum Qualifications)

To be considered for an internship position with Oracle Design, you must possess the Objective Minimum Qualifications below. Please ensure that your application clearly indicates that you meet these qualifications either on your resume and/or by uploading additional documents such as a transcript. 

  • Current undergraduate junior-year student or graduating senior with a passion for design and interest in entering the UX Design field; extensive design experience is not required as a pre-requisite, and we encourage non-traditional backgrounds (e.g., studying fine art, architecture, psychology, brand and marketing, engineering, etc.)
  • Available full-time, 40 hours per week during the work week (typically 9am-5pm) from June-September 2024
  • Attend a university in the US
  • Able to obtain work authorization in the US in 2024

About You (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Emerging creative professional with a passion for creating experiences for a diverse community of users
  • Excited to bring your unique voice and perspective to Oracle Design’s creative team
  • Inquisitive and open-minded, collaborative and a fantastic teammate
  • Interested in becoming a fantastic storyteller: passionate about improving your creative techniques to tell a compelling story
  • You don’t already know everything, and love to learn; you’re open to consuming quantitative and qualitative data to refine your assumptions
  • Have deep empathy and a passion for understanding people, uncovering their values and unspoken needs, and designing solutions with these values and needs at the heart of it all
  • You may have learned your craft through formal training in school or passion projects and hobbies. For most people, it is a combination of both.
  • Have specific skills, or the desire to grow your abilities in one or more of the following areas: Strategy & Innovation, UX & UI Design, Visual/Motion Design, User Research, Prototyping, Design Production, and more
  • You might currently be studying, or enrolled in coursework in one or more of the following areas: user experience, graphic/visual design, motion design, game design animation, photography, behavioral science, interface design, multimedia design and technology, entrepreneurship courses, product design, industrial design, human factors, design thinking, information design, civil engineering, service design, or other relevant coursework
  • Your major(s) could include Product Design, Computer Graphics, Graphic Design, Interaction Design, Industrial Design, Media Arts, Visual Communications, Computer Science, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Behavioral Science, Content Design, and more (if you’re a creative problem solver and wanting to explore a career in UX, and don’t see your major listed here, please still apply!)
  • Share your design portfolio or 2-3 examples of design-related work you’re most proud of. Highlight your ability to work with teams, think outside of the box, think strategically, and communicate through a visual medium. These examples can be pulled from school projects, passion projects, or from any other previous work experience.

 

As a UX Design Intern You Will…

As an Oracle Design UX Intern, you will join a cohort of creative young professionals in our Bay Area and Seattle offices. Throughout the 12-week internship program, you will receive guided mentorship and participate in boot-camp style workshops. Through hands-on participation in group projects, you will deepen your knowledge and practice new skills in a variety of design subject areas including Strategy & Innovation, User Experience & User Interface (UI) Design, Visual/Motion Design, User Research, Prototyping, Design Production, and more. 

Upon successful completion of your internship, you’ll have the chance to apply for a full-time, paid position that aligns with your interests and abilities. 

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)

Oracle Design is dedicated to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace culture that reflects the opinions and perspectives of many different backgrounds and experiences. As an intern, you will join our global design team and add your unique point of view to our workforce. We’re committed to hiring employees from a wide range of backgrounds not only because diversity is a key driver of innovation, but it ensures we build products that best reflect the needs of our broad customer base. And most importantly, because it’s the right thing to do. Recent studies show that the design industry is in dire need of opening opportunities to young professionals underrepresented in the field, and we’re working hard to correct this imbalance. We’re committed to including, listening, and learning together on this journey. 

Interested in joining our team?

Oracle Design is an Equal Opportunity employer and have a strong commitment to the principle of diversity in all areas. We have a bent towards creating success for every employee by appreciating the uniqueness that each person brings to the workplace. Oracle Design strongly encourages applications from people from underrepresented backgrounds, women, LGBTQ+ candidates, veterans, and differently abled candidates. We welcome applications from individuals from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

ShortDescriptionStr:
Grow your UX Design Career with Oracle Design 
Oracle Design is seeking current undergraduate junior students and graduating seniors who are looking to enter the exciting world of User Experience (UX) Design in Summer 2024. Thrive in this crucial role! We are a group of 600+ multi-disciplinary creatives from around the globe, dedicated to making the design profession more accessible and inclusive. Come and join our diverse and dynamic team to create brand-new applications that connect, empower, and delight our users. We are excited to work with you early in your career.

Title: Change Implementation Analyst
ExternalDescriptionStr:
The Change Implementation Analyst role is an entry-level support job in Support Services, Global Services organization. This role is responsible for performing solution-related service request configuration for application maintenance. This person will perform scope assessment by capturing information, using application tools for configuring the system, apply and execute the change management processes, presenting and shadowing end users, and testing workflows for accuracy of configuration. They will also perform high level consultation on solution best practices and standards of build. This resource is a contractually committed, client facing function to deliver a fixed fee agreement with service level requirements. If the service level requirements are not met, we will pay a portion of revenue back to the client and additionally be at risk of client being able to opt out of contract, both resulting in reduced revenue.

InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
In this role, you will provide guidance and real time resolution on a wide variety of technical and non-technical customer issues including, but not limited to: product compatibility and configuration, support entitlements and validation, electronic support solve and product availability. Handle open service requests that are dispatched, implement fixes, analyze the software problem and write case notes in the tracking system. Work is semi-routine in nature. Support may be delivered via electronic channels (web, e-mail, etc.) or phone. Position may work in a call center environment as needed. Also, you will be the point of contact for new customers, introducing and educating them on Oracle as a whole. You will also have the opportunity to gain knowledge of specific product areas within our core technologies and/or applications.

Basic Qualifications
At least 2 years total combined related work experience and completed higher education
Receipt of the appropriate government security clearance card applicable for your position
Due to the client contract, you will be assigned, this position requires you to be a U.S. citizen
 

Preferred Qualifications
At least 1 year of clinical or customer service experience

This is a hybrid role and required to be in the Office 2-3 times a week.

We invite you to apply if you have the above skillset and experience!

Title: Oracle Health Delivery Consultant I Onsite
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Delivery Consultant I / ONSITE: Winona, MN

Work with Oracle Health world class technology to develop, implement, and support Oracle Health global infrastructure.

Provide support to users of Oracle Health / Cerner Applications and legacy applications to ensure maximum efficiency in the use of those applications. Respond to requests for support by users. Validate new releases of Oracle Health / Cerner Applications. Log issues against applications and follow up with IT and Development. Supervise future applications releases. Train users on features of applications. Maintain applications responsibilities based on work group of user. Act as reporting resource.

Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. BS or equivalent work experience preferred.

Responsibilities:

As a Delivery Consultant, you will advise clients during implementations to deliver client-specific venue configuration, testing, and training. As a member of this team, you are responsible for advising clients on current workflows and configurations, upgrade implications, system changes and enhancements as well as ongoing system maintenance for clinical and non-clinical applications. In addition, you will complete client-specific design, configuration and solve with appropriate tools, complete full solution build with accountability for build and follow up actions. You will also develop and complete test plans and test script execution and note changes in end user functionality while also reviewing new defects, write steps to test, outline information for change requests and notify clients. Finally, your responsibilities will also include identifying and advancing issues to solution and engagement leadership while also bringing to bear internal and external resources to deliver problem identification and resolution. 

Basic Qualifications

  • At least 4 years of total combined higher education and related work experience

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant work experience.
  • At least 1 year of health care information technology project management, sales or consulting work experience
  • At least 1 year of Systems management or implementation work experience
  • Must live in or be willing to relocate to the Winona, MN area

Expectations

  • Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations
  • Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position
  • Perform other responsibilities as assigned
  • Must live in or be willing to relocate to the Winona, MN area

Title: Customer Success Intern
ExternalDescriptionStr:
We are looking for collaborative intern(s) who are excited to work closely with cross-functional teams.  The candidate will have the opportunity to learn and work alongside Oracle’s Support Organization this Summer 2024. Training will be given at the beginning of the internship with various internal teams for overall knowledge of the Digital renewal Center.  The focus will be on interns getting the experience they will need to succeed within Oracle or another organization. Interns will join team meetings, be a part of an existing team, work with other internal teams, have individual goals / requirements, report to trainers and managers, and are expected to provide feedback to the trainers and managers to help improve the intern program.

ShortDescriptionStr: As a member of Oracle's Support Organization, you will be responsible for answering inbound customer calls and emails as it pertains to their support renewals. Ensure customer awareness and understanding of applicable elements of the Support Portfolio. Manage exceptions for customers with issues that may delay or inhibit renewals. Identify and transfer leads to sales reps for new opportunities. Accurately forecast business targets and opportunities in assigned accounts.

8. Paid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.
9. 11 paid holidays
10. Paid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.
11. Paid parental leave

14. Financial planning and group legal
15. Voluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance
InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
Job Responsibilities:

The primary focus of the Support Renewal Representative is to act as a customer liaison for all Premier Support Service’s questions and order quoting and processing. With 7 different roles in the Digital Renewals Center, we have

  • Readiness- reviewing renewal quotes to make sure pricing is accurate compared to the original order prior to being published online.
  • Booking- reviewing information from the customers commitment (purchase order) to make sure it aligns with the quote.
  • Customer Outreach- Working directly with customers via email and phone discussing the support renewal while working through any questions or concerns.
  • Customer Assistance- Answer phones calls or online chats from our renewal’s hotline.
  • Retention- Working directly with at risk customers to quickly resolve issues and secure the support renewal.
  • Data Management- Making changes to renewal quotes with pricing or contact information.
  • Billing Arbitration- Making corrections on invoices while working with customers on past due invoices.

 

Qualifications & Characteristics:

  • Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. 
  • Excellent customer service skills answering phones and emails.
  • Works independently within defined policies and procedures.
  • Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and analytical skills.
  • Motivated self-starter and curious.
  • The position is technical / sales oriented. Microsoft Office experience is required.

Title: Solution Analyst
ExternalDescriptionStr:
As a member of the Support organization, you will resolve post-sales customer inquiries via phone and electronic means. Your focus is to provide level two support including problem resolution within published goals using the Knowledge Base, write product documentation, use Web Resources, and Lab Testing, etc. to resolve issues.In this role, you will provide guidance and real time resolution on a wide range of technical and non-technical customer issues including, but not limited to: product compatibility and configuration, license reconciliation, support entitlements and validation, invoice and shipping inquiries, electronic support troubleshooting and product availability. Handle open service requests that are dispatched, implement fixes, (i.e. writing SQL scripts, and document the case for escalation), analyze the hardware or software problem and write case notes in the tracking system. Work is semi-routine in nature. Support may be delivered via electronic channels (web, e-mail, etc.) or phone. Position may work in a call center environment as needed. Also, you will be the point of contact for new customers, introducing and educating them on Oracle as a whole. You will also have the opportunity to gain knowledge of specific product areas within our core technologies and/or applications.Prior working knowledge of or the desire to quickly learn about Oracle products. In addition, you will need to understand the use of operating systems, hardware environments, software, networking, Oracle products and how they all interrelate in a customer environment. An ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent communication skills, demonstrate prior abilities to be an effective team player, and will demonstrate commitment to ensuring customer success. Associates degree. At least 1 year of related experience. 

 

Career Level -

Career Level -
CorporateDescriptionStr:
As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
As a Solution Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting Oracle Health’s internal and external clients by providing outstanding customer service and basic technical support in a Tier 1 call-centered environment.  You will be responsible for serving as the first line to investigate and resolve client problems received through phone, ticket or other electronic means, triaging and escalating issues by using applicable monitoring and troubleshooting tools, and performing routine, preapproved changes to client domains.  You will also be responsible for troubleshooting investigations, reviewing front-end applications by gathering information, using troubleshooting tools, shadowing end users, and testing workflows internally and externally, performing troubleshooting investigations via backend methods by capturing log files, querying tables, updating database fields, and updating/cycling servers.

Much of your time will be spent investigating service requests, resolving client incidents and maintaining applications. As you work with Oracle Cerner technologies, you prioritize and plan issue resolutions both independently and in a collaborative and fast-paced team environment. You will work directly with clients, so strong communication and customer service skills are needed. You will also be responsible for adhering to policies and procedures including HIPAA, PECA, CHIA, and client notification requirements.

When hired into the Client Services Academy, you reap big benefits. During training, you will gain insights into Oracle Cerner ’s support methodology and will begin project work immediately. You’ll work alongside the experts to gain knowledge and skills that will prepare you for a long-term, meaningful career with Oracle Cerner .

Basic Qualifications:

At least 4 years total combined related work experience and completed higher education 

Receipt of the appropriate government security clearance card applicable for your position

Due to the client contract you will be assigned, this position requires you to be a U.S. citizen

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree 

At least 1 year of call center or phone support work experience

Located near an Oracle Health office: Kansas City, MO, Malvern, PA, Burlington, MA, Columbia, MD or Orlando, FL

Expectations:

Ability to work one of the following shifts available for the position (all in CT): 

Traditional Monday through Friday shifts from 5:00 AM - 2:00 PM, 6:00 AM - 3:00 PM, 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM, or 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Swing shifts Monday through Friday from 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM, 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM, or 12:00 PM - 9:00 PM 

4X10 shifts Monday through Thursday, Wednesday through Saturday, or Sunday through Wednesday from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM or 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM

554 shifts from 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM, 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM, 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM or 554 night shifts from 6:00 PM - 6:00 AM, 7:00 PM - 7:00 AM, 8:00 PM - 8:00 AM 

Home internet speed and reliability connection must meet the following expectations: Download >= 20 Mbps and Upload >= 5 Mbps at www.speedtest.net and Total packet Loss https://packetlosstest.com/ OR the ability to work in the Oracle Cerner office

If located in the following metropolitan areas, you may be required to work in office during normal business operations: 

Kansas City, MO

Malvern, PA

Burlington, MA

Columbia, MD

Orlando, FL

Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position

Perform other responsibilities as assigned

Ability to work one of the following shifts available for the position (all in CT): 

Traditional Monday through Friday shifts from 5:00 AM - 2:00 PM, 6:00 AM - 3:00 PM, 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM, or 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Swing shifts Monday through Friday from 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM, 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM, or 12:00 PM - 9:00 PM 

4X10 shifts Monday through Thursday, Wednesday through Saturday, or Sunday through Wednesday from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM or 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM

554 shifts from 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM, 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM, 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM or 554 night shifts from 6:00 PM - 6:00 AM, 7:00 PM - 7:00 AM, 8:00 PM - 8:00 AM 

Home internet speed and reliability connection must meet the following expectations: Download >= 20 Mbps and Upload >= 5 Mbps at www.speedtest.net and Total packet Loss https://packetlosstest.com/ OR the ability to work in the Oracle Cerner office

If located in the following metropolitan areas, you may be required to work in office during normal business operations: 

Kansas City, MO

Malvern, PA

Burlington, MA

Columbia, MD

Orlando, FL

Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position

Perform other responsibilities as assigned

Title: Functional EPM Cloud Engineer
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Role: Functional EPM Cloud Engineer

Location: Telecommuting/remote from within the US

Note: sponsorship is not available for this position

Customer Success Services is looking for a junior professional with hands-on functional background in the Oracle EPM Cloud (SaaS) and/or Oracle Hyperion (on-prem) suite of products. The ideal candidate understands not only the concepts of Financials but also how they apply to the day-to-day processes of a Production business environment. Will be responsible for supporting critical business operations, working independently to provide quality services to multiple customer engagements. Will collaborate with multi-functional teams and be a part of complete project experience from concept to implementation.

 

Career Level - IC2

Title: Business Development Manager - Inside Sales
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Business Development Manager - Inside Sales

Locations: Austin, TX; Nashville, TN or Denver, CO ONLY

No visa sponsorship is available for this position

A BDR managers purpose is to lead a team by building a culture of highly effective outbound demand generation specialists.  Focused on achieving high results, impacting revenue in alignment with GIU GTM strategy. The primary focus of a Business Development Representative Manager is to lead a team of BDRs focused on generating pipeline that drives revenue through targeted outbound campaigns and sales plays for the Oracle Global Industry Unit (GIU).  Sales pipeline is primarily generated through targeted outreach via multi-channel touchpoints including phone, email, and social outreach.  BDR managers will collaborate with peers across demand generation, sales, marketing & sales operations.  They will build and lead a team of industry sales specialists responsible for uncovering 5-star quality BANT qualified opportunities.  As a BDR manager, you will be the face of the industry demand generation team.  Engaging with leaders ranging from director to SVP level.  

Our Investment in You:
We believe deeply in growth, learning, and development. Our BDR Teams are trained regularly on core sales skills including social selling, sales foundations, value, and solution messaging. We're committed to fostering an environment where your skills, ambitions, and passions flourish. From comprehensive professional development opportunities to a supportive network that encourages your growth, we're dedicated to cultivating your potential. Your journey with us isn't just about the role you fill, it's about the limitless possibilities we create together. Join us, and let's invest in your success, making strides towards mutual growth and achievement. 
 

Your Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of BDRs focused on generating 5-Star BANT qualified opportunities through outbound prospecting.
  • Grow industry market share through new logo revenue generation.
  • Be an all-star teammate that brings their best to work every day and displays teamwork by sharing best practices, collaborating, and working with colleagues on a global scale. 
  • Engage, collaborate, and cultivate stakeholder relationships across multiple LOB. 
  • Hire, develop and lead a team of “Hunters” with a mission to drive revenue.
  • Become the industry expert across your team, with the ability to train team members in solution knowledge, messaging, and overall prospecting skills.
  • Leverage Oracle tools to drive operational efficiency across your team.
  • Strategize and collaborate with sales and marketing team members while driving outbound campaigns and sales plays in alignment with Industry go to market strategy.
  • BDR managers often lead global teams, which requires flexibility in work hours and periodic travel.

About You:

•   You are an achiever with a track record of excellence and strong results leading a BDR or sales team.
•   You are goal oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills.
•   You are comfortable, engaging, presenting, and collaborating with executive leadership.
•   You are known for your tremendous work ethic, passion, and dedication.
•   You can work independently, navigate ambiguous situations, and use strong judgement.
•   You enjoy learning new things including technology and can translate that into value propositions for prospects.
•   You have a positive presence, and you are curious, insightful, and perceptive.


Preferred Requirements:

  • You have a Bachelor’s degree.
  • In lieu of a bachelor’s degree, you have at minimum 5 years of relative work experience leading a team.
  • You have 2+ years’ experience in sales and/or a business development outbound prospecting role. 
  • You have a minimum of 3 years leading a business development and/or sales team.
  • Software and technology experience is not required. 
  • Industry domain experience preferred.
  • Resides within commuting distance of an Oracle office.

Title: Senior Material Handler-Receiving
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Department
Oracle Manufacturing and Distribution (M&D) is responsible for distribution of network, desktop hardware, software, and marketing material to Oracle’s internal and external customers worldwide. M&D's mission is to continually deliver high-quality products, services, and interactions, on time, to our customers.

 

The Role

The Senior Material Handler supports the receiving activities including unloading, sorting, inspecting, processing, labeling, storing, and transacting of incoming materials. They also process the Asset Reclaim returns (laptops) from existing and exiting employees; ensures all incoming delivery matches the company purchase order, ensures accurate, timely processing of receiving and return materials and kitting jobs, and ensures accuracy of warehouse inventory, including excess parts, system inventory and scrapped inventory. They will also be responsible for inventory control, materials handling, count inventory to match with the system, put away, restocking, order fulfillment, and to organize the labs and warehouses.

InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
Specific duties include and are not limited to the following:

Assist in the movement of materials and inventory between various locations onsite and between offsite locations; Replenish stock, maintaining inventory, and moving items to increase picking efficiency; Maintain a high level of inventory accuracy and integrity by completing inventory control counts, audits and/or reconciliations to ensure company inventory accuracy goals; Operate Warehouse Equipment: Forklift, Pallet Jack, Cherry Picker as needed; Ability to drive and operate company vehicles, van, and box truck; Verify and ensure materials/supplies are properly labeled and stored; Return materials to warehouse locations after receipt using material handling equipment, including forklifts; Follow all safety guidelines by maintaining a clean safe warehouse; Consistently demonstrating and incorporating principals of safety for self and others within daily activities; Perform data entry and system transactions using Oracle applications; Ensure highest quality product deliveries within established lead times; Review and update procedures to ensure accuracy to meet business requirements; Assisting team with various projects as needed; Review and update procedures to ensure accuracy to meet business requirements; Identify areas for process improvement, cost savings, and collaborate with associates to improve efficiency, productivity, and processes.; Troubleshoot basic issues independently and report issues to management. Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures.

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent experience in manufacturing and distribution.
  • Basic PC skills: Word, Excel, etc.
  • 0-1 years of experience in high volume warehouse environment
  • Driven, self-motivated, with a strong attention to detail
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Dedicated/reliable with positive, “can do” attitude
  • Proficient in shipping processes and specifications both domestically and internationally
  • Willingness to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Exhibits strong organizational skills, and follow-through and with the ability to maintain professionalism under pressure.

Work Requirements

  • Senior Material Handler is a critical role and will report to our Redwood Shores, CA office daily. This position does not offer telework or remote/working from home options.
  • Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.
  • Sitting, standing, or walking for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to constantly lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs.; occasionally up to 100 lbs.
  • Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, power tools, and other computer components.
  • Ability to drive an automatic vehicle (truck or van) and operate any material handling equipment

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Software Engineer
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Are you interested in building large-scale. distributed infrastructure services for the cloud? Oracle’s Cloud Infrastructure team is building Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IAAS) technologies that operate at high scale in a broadly distributed multi-tenant cloud environment. Our customers run their businesses on our cloud, and our mission is to provide them with industry leading compute, storage, networking, database, security, and an ever expanding set of foundational cloud-based services.

As part of this effort, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure's  Object Storage Service team is looking for hands-on engineers with a passion for solving  problems. You will be working on distributed systems, large scale storage, and highly available services. If this is you, you can be part of the team that drives the best in class Object Storage Service into the next phase of its development. These are exciting times for the service - we are growing fast, and delivering on innovative, enterprise class features to satisfy the most demanding workloads for our customers. An engineer at any level can have significant technical and business impact.

As a software engineer in this team,  you will have the opportunity to own the design and development for major components and features of the Object Storage Service. You should be a solid coder, with interest in  distributed systems. You should value simplicity and scale, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and be excited to learn and be mentored.

Basic Qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent
  • 1-2+ years experience in software development, preferably in cloud technologies
  • Strong knowledge of Java / C++ and experience with scripting languages such as Python
  • Strong knowledge or coursework in data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and distributed systems fundamentals.
CorporateDescriptionStr:
As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer
ShortDescriptionStr: Looking for a Java / C++ software developer with passion and drive. Knowledge of Python, RESTful APIs, Cloud Technologies will be considered a strong plus.

Disclaimer:

Range and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only

US: Hiring Range: from $62,100 to $158,200 per annum. May be eligible for bonus and equity.

Oracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle’s differing products, industries and lines of business.
Candidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.

Oracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:
1. Medical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion
2. Short term disability and long term disability
3. Life insurance and AD&D
4. Supplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
5. Health care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts
6. Pre-tax commuter and parking benefits
7. 401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match
8. Paid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.
9. 11 paid holidays
10. Paid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.
11. Paid parental leave
12. Adoption assistance
13. Employee Stock Purchase Plan
14. Financial planning and group legal
15. Voluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance

Title: Technical Program Manager (Customer Success Services)
ExternalDescriptionStr:
What You’ll Bring:

To be considered for a Technical Program Manager position in the Customer Success Services organization, you must possess the Objective Minimum Qualifications below. 

  • Have a bachelor’s degree in business, Economics, Industrial engineering, or an equivalent science/ engineering field.
  • Strong academic record with a focus on project management, software development lifecycle, or related coursework would be an added advantage.
  • Have no more than 12 months of professional full-time work experience in the technology field (excluding internships, research and/or teaching assistant roles, and military experience).
  • Ability to collaborate with engineers and senior executives.
  • Passion for technology and a keen curiosity about program management.
  • Outstanding communication and social skills.
  • Exceptional organizational and multitasking abilities.
  • Proactive problem-solving approach with the ability to adapt to a dynamic environment.
  • Ability to keep up with advancements in the field of technical product development.
  • Ability to evaluate product performance metrics and diagnose and resolve issues.
  • Proficiency in programming languages and coding, such as SQL, Python, and JavaScript.
  • Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies is a plus.
  • Passion for learning and a dedication to professional development.
  • Experience in event planning is a plus.

InternalResponsibilitiesStr:
What You’ll Do:

  • The Customer Success Services (CSS) is a unit within Oracle’s Customer Service Organization that enables long-term advanced support relationships with many of Oracle's largest customers.
  • Our goal is for every customer to gain ever more value from their Oracle Solutions by helping them make well-informed decisions regarding the implementation, management and use of Oracle technologies.

What We’ll Give You:

  • Significant investment in your professional development and a social network of resources and leaders with vision inside Oracle.
  • Fun and flexible work for the ideal work-life balance
  • An inspiring, inclusive, and multicultural community that values fresh perspectives.
  • A buddy program: a senior leader will be assigned to work closely with you to help you making connections and learning the business.
  • Elite professional training from industry guides.
  • A defined career progression based on annual performance and personal development followed closely by a direct manager.
  • The opportunity to engage with a variety of customers in multiple areas.
  • Competitive pay and excellent benefits that will help you do your best work.

Title: Oracle Financing Division (OFD) Intern
ExternalDescriptionStr:
The Team

Oracle Financing closes ~$2b+ in annual global business through a portfolio of custom payment options; tailored IT investment strategies; and keen advisory insights for financial optimization. We offer flexibility, choice, and guidance that helps customers in 50+ countries and emerging markets to acquire the Oracle solutions they need – in the cloud, on premises, and in hybrid environments. 

 

The Role

As a member of OFD’s Global Strategy & Sales Enablement team, you’ll work closely with a group of experts handling demand generation, data analysis, report generation, graphic design, tool development, campaign and program management, UX/UI design, and more. The internship offers an outstanding opportunity to build global experience while working closely with sales, marketing, and other strategic functions throughout the world.

This is not a “copies and coffee runs” kind of internship.  From our leaders on down, we’re all utility players with a passion for affecting positive business outcomes.  You’ll be encouraged to sit at the table as a collaborative member of the team – to take on what’s needed, offer perspectives, and adapt to help the team meet emerging opportunities in this multifaceted environment. Every day requires you to bring your A-game.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop and manage targeted internal and external GTM assets, as needed.
  • Build, publish, and maintain regional win stories in core repositories.
  • Build and publish operational process documentation.
  • Assemble, run, and complete regional Slack and HTML email campaigns.
  • Undertake layout and basic graphic design work in support of brand communications. 
  • Support regional business development and messaging initiatives.
  • Participate on relevant internal project teams and initiatives.
  • Ensure materials reflect and uphold Oracle brand standards and OFD guidelines.
  • Gather and assess data that helps bolster sales success and effectiveness.

Career Level - IC0

Title: Support Analyst
ExternalDescriptionStr:
Join us in making a significant impact within the Oracle Health Support organization!

As a valued member of our Support team, you'll play a crucial role in assisting patients with resolving issues related to their patient portals, utilizing both phone and electronic channels. Your primary focus will be on delivering exceptional support, meeting predefined goals, using our Knowledge Base, creating product documentation, using web resources, and conducting testing to efficiently address concerns.

In this dynamic position, you'll provide timely guidance and resolution to patients across a spectrum of technical and non-technical challenges, ranging from product navigation to registration and account management. 

Whether working remotely or in a call center environment, you'll serve as the frontline liaison between patients and our clients, fostering positive experiences and ensuring satisfaction!

As you grow in this role, you'll deepen your understanding of our core technologies and applications, becoming a trusted expert in specific product areas. While prior experience with Oracle products is beneficial, we welcome individuals eager to learn and adapt quickly.

Proficiency in operating systems, hardware, software, networking, and the interrelationships among these elements in customer environments is essential.

Outstanding communication skills, adept time management abilities, and a proven track record of collaboration are critical in this role. We're seeking individuals who are committed to customer success and have a passion for delivering excellence in every interaction!

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on others and grow your skills within a supportive and dynamic environment, we invite you to apply to our Oracle Health Support team!

Title: Client Services Implementation Specialist - Textura
ExternalDescriptionStr:
The Textura Client Services team manages all aspects of the client lifecycle, including sales support, implementation, account and relationship management, and ongoing support of the TPM application. In this role, the Client Services Implementation Specialist will collaborate with all levels of the Client Services group, as well as the Production Support and Product teams, to deliver TPM to our clients and support project implementations by ensuring delivery timelines are followed and issues are tracked and escalated as needed.  We are goal oriented and driven to exceed client expectations. With that, come many opportunities for growth including career development support and exposure to a thriving industry! 

Accountabilities:

As a Client Services Implementation Specialist, you will work directly with Oracle’s clients and collaborate with team members to ensure our clients are successful in their use of TPM.  By providing exceptional service over the phone, through e-mail, and in person at client locations, you will help our clients improve productivity, mitigate risk and enhance project communication through our cloud-based solution, Oracle Textura Payment Management.  The Client Services team is a fast paced, energetic, everchanging environment. 

  • Lead and assist with the implementation of the Oracle Textura Payment Management solution for both new and existing clients
  • Manage a portfolio of client accounts – includes proactive account management, revenue forecasting, protecting revenue by ensuring client satisfaction, and driving implementations to expand revenue
  • Answer support calls/emails and work with clients to fully understand, troubleshoot and resolve issues
  • Opportunities to support TPM sales efforts – includes presenting demos, preparing custom cost-benefit analyses, and sending follow up material
  • Work with clients to identify, define, prioritize, and implement new system functionality
  • Lead web-based and on-site training for both new and current Oracle clients
  • Work closely with cross departmental teams to resolve issues in a timely manner
  • Demonstrate initiative to taking on increasingly challenging projects

Career Level - IC1
